Short: [IHE PHARM White Paper] Logical Model for order
Definition: A prescription is issued by one ordering healthcare professional for one patient, in the context of zero or one encounter (between the patient and the ordering physician and/or the healthcare institution).

Short: The business identifier(s) for the medication Order
Definition: The business identifier(s) for the medication order

Short: When prescription was initially made
Definition: When prescription was initially made

Short: The person for which the medication is prescribed.
Definition: The person for which the medication is prescribed.

Short: Reason for prescribing (e.g. diagnosis, prognosis, protocol, clinical assessment …)(may or may not be explicitly stated)
Definition: Reason for prescribing (e.g. diagnosis, prognosis, protocol, clinical assessment …)(may or may not be explicitly stated)

Short: Additional Information about the prescription
Definition: Additional Information about the prescription

Short: Who made the prescription
Definition: Who made the prescription

Short: Status of the prescription ORDERED|PLACED|IN PROGRESS|COMPLETED|CANCELLED|DISCONTINUED|SUSPENDED
Definition: Status of the prescription ORDERED|PLACED|IN PROGRESS|COMPLETED|CANCELLED|DISCONTINUED|SUSPENDED

Short: A prescription item belongs to one prescription and represents one prescribed medication. It may  be associated with one or more observations. Prescription Item is the atomic entity for logistics, distribution and billing.
Definition: A prescription item belongs to one prescription and represents one prescribed medication. It may  be associated with one or more observations. Prescription Item is the atomic entity for logistics, distribution and billing.

Short: Prescription Item ID
Definition: Prescription Item ID

Short: Beginning date of treatment / length of treatment / End of treatment date ( the date the treatment is due to end) and/or number of renewals
Definition: Beginning date of treatment / length of treatment / End of treatment date ( the date the treatment is due to end) and/or number of renewals

Short: Reason for prescribing (e.g. diagnosis, prognosis, protocol, clinical assessment …)
Definition: Reason for prescribing (e.g. diagnosis, prognosis, protocol, clinical assessment …)

Short: Substitution allowed or not (can the pharmacist do a substitution of medication?)
Definition: Substitution allowed or not (can the pharmacist do a substitution of medication?)

Short: Route of administration
Definition: Route of administration

Short: Intake pattern for the medication
Definition: Intake pattern for the medication

Short: Diagnosis or reason for prescribing is this similar the 3rd bullet point?
Definition: Diagnosis or reason for prescribing is this similar the 3rd bullet point?

Short: Alert about prescribing restrictions
Definition: Alert about prescribing restrictions

Short: Related to a chronic disease or not (listed or unlisted)
Definition: Related to a chronic disease or not (listed or unlisted)

Short: Specific follow-up elements
Definition: Specific follow-up elements

Short: Additional comment (may be used by the prescriber to inform the pharmacist that he is aware of a potential ICA)
Definition: Additional comment (may be used by the prescriber to inform the pharmacist that he is aware of a potential ICA)

Short: Status (see the “Relevant Standards” chapter)
Definition: Status (see the “Relevant Standards” chapter)
